column3: Does your organization have an organized system of identifying and managing accounts based upon type, group membership?
Are access rights and privileges mapped according to job specification and group membership?
Describe the request/approval process for establishing a new or escalating an existing account.
Does your organization allow the use of guest/anonymous accounts? If so, how is guest access managed and recorded?

Describe the procedure for account deactivation upon employee termination. This includes the complete communication chain from human resources to the information technology employee responsible for account maintenance.
How often are accounts audited and aged?
Does your organization use multi-factor authentication for account access?
Who is responsible for managing/maintaining the past and current identifications used in the authentication system?
Do you have access agreements (formal or informal) with third parties to access your systems? How often are these agreements reviewed and updated?
Does your organization have a single sign-on authentication system? If so, what?
Does your organization have systems attached to the network, which use a different authentication system other than the organizations centralized system?

Does your organization have remote access to the control network? What policies and procedures are in place regarding the identification/authentication/authorization and monitoring of such access? How are these events audited?
Does your organization have specific policies and procedures in regards to the procurement and use of cloud-based external system services?
Do you have a log management plan and system?
Describe the process and frequency at which log files are audited and reported.
Who is responsible for the auditing and accountability process? To whom are the reports on auditable events submitted? Are these reports coordinated with any other organizational events?
Does your organization implement a communications monitoring system at key internal boundaries within the network?
Describe the use of cryptographic keys and their management within your organization.
Describe the use of encryption and its management within your organization?

Does your organization have a systematic plan and process for baseline configuration management? How are systems developed, documented, and maintained? This should include a discussion of firmware and software patch management?
Describe your current change management process.
How is the configuration/change management process audited?
Is there an inventory of all systems and critical components available for review? Who is responsible for maintaining this inventory?
Does each system have a “factory default” configuration that meets operational and security policies of the organization?
Does your organization have a written Continuity of Operations Plan? Who is responsible for the creation/maintenance of this plan?
Who is responsible for the auditing of the Continuity of Operations Plan?
How often is the Continuity of Operations Plan reviewed and updated?
Describe the professional development exercises used to keep all key personnel trained in the procedures of the Continuity of Operations Plan.
Does your organization have a written Disaster Recovery plan? Who is responsible for the creation/maintenance of this plan?
Who is responsible for the auditing of the Disaster Recovery Plan?
How often is the Disaster Recovery Plan reviewed and updated?
Describe the professional development exercise used to keep all key personnel trained in the procedures of the Disaster Recovery Plan.
Describe the system backup plans for key systems within the organization.
Does the organization have a policy and set of procedures that dictate the process and granularity of the backups?
How is the backup process audited and at what frequency is it audited?
Describe the procedures and processes that safeguard the confidentiality and integrity of the backup media in transit and at the storage location.
Does your organization have an Incident Response Program?
Describe the professional development exercises conducted to assure that key personnel understands how to properly use the system.
How is the information captured in the Incident Response Program used to improve the overall business process?
How is use of the Incident Response Program audited for proper application?
Does the organization have a centralized security monitoring and mitigation system to address inappropriate use of the infrastructure?
Describe the centralized resources that address viruses, malware, intrusion detection, and instruction prevention.
How are these systems and with what frequency are these systems updated?
Describe the involvement of human resources and legal counsel with regard to system monitoring activities?
Does your organization use any penetration testing services, internal or external, and tools for proactive security?
Who is responsible for information security in your organization?
Does your organization employ security professionals/SMEs directly? If so, how many? What certifications do they hold?
How often do personnel responsible for information security participate in professional development exercises?
Describe any human resource screening processes, which are used to determine personnel acceptability for system resource privilege.
Describe the physical access control program protecting key areas of your facility. Who is responsible for this program?
How frequently are physical access controls and corresponding logs audited? Who is responsible for these audits?
Are physical security events and audit findings coordinated with your incident response team?
Aside from the Continuity of Operations Plan and Disaster Recovery Plan, does your organization have independent Risk Management and Security Plans?
Who is responsible for the creation/maintenance of these plans?
Who is responsible for the auditing and reporting of these plans?
Does your organization have a procedure for assuring that all procurements and RFPs include information security baseline requirements?
How often are your IT policies comprehensively reviewed?
Do you have a subset of policies that are security specific?
How often do you conduct professional development exercises for employees to increase familiarity with these policies?

Does your organization have an Acceptable/Responsible Use policy? Is each member of the organization required to sign a document stating that they have read and understand the policy? Can these documents be located within a reasonable amount of time?
Does your organization have policies and procedures specifically addressing the generation and use of passwords? Is a complexity standard specified?
Does your organization have a system Change Management Policy?
Does your organization have a Security Awareness and Training Policy?
Does your organization have an Information and Document Management Policy?
Does your organization have a portable media / mobile device policy?
Does your organization have a policy specifically addressing wireless network access (internal and guest access)?
Does each IT/Security policy have a corresponding set of procedures?
